div.p: Resources to assist families during the Coronavirus Outbreak.
There is help for families that need information about Community Resources available during the Coronavirus Outbreak!CVS Community Resource Message Line: (586) 723-2280

p.br:
If you are in crisis or overwhelmed by any situation,call
1-586-307-9100
at any time, to talk to a trained crisis counselor. Confidential, private, and you don't need to give your name.

div.div: Continuity of Learning and Covid-19 Response Plan

div.p: Parents: Check out the CVS Continuity of Learning and Covid-19 Response Plan.

p.a: Remote learning for students and parents.

div.p:
Do you need help logging in to Schoology?
Email to: cvstechhelp@cvs.k12.mi.us
Information on childcare options for Essential Workers

In our ongoing effort to provide our families with the resources they need during this school closure, we would like to offer the following FREE breakfast and lunch program for our students in need. Please take note of the dates, times, and locations available to you.
It's time to Choose Chippewa!Applications are now available for School of Choice for grades K-11, for fall enrollment. Macomb County families know to Choose Chippewa for educational excellence!

Parents: Kindergarten registration will resume when schools reopen. Welcome Class of 2033! Registration begins February 3rd for district residents. Check out the Building Hours of Registration. Please complete all registration paperwork prior to enrolling. Paperwork can be found on the Kindergarten webpage.

div.div: Board of Education Agendas & Meeting Minutes

div.span: If you have questions about community resources, check your school website, the district site, or you can call the CVS Community Resource Message Line at (586) 723-2280 between 8am and 4pm weekdays.
Stay current with our COVID-19 updates here.
Chippewa Valley is working hard to provide you with our updates as they come.
We serve breakfast at many of our schools. Check out the attached listing for prices and times. Whole grain and hearty, we offer many choices.

If you are in crisis or overwhelmed by any situation, call 586-307-9100 at anytime, to talk to a trained crisis counselor. Confidential, private, and you don't need to give your name.
Get information on childcare for Essential Workers.
Chippewa Valley 2020 Festival of the Arts

Beginning on April 28th - May 7th visit the Clinton Macomb Public Library at 40900 Romeo Plank in Clinton Twp. Art display hours: M-TH 9am-9pm, F - Sat 9am - 6pm and Sunday 12pm - 6pm. Musical performances May 5th beginning at 6:30pm.

Open to all students K-12 with challenges based on STEAM. Challenges are designed to teach the creative process. Many new and exciting hands-on activities.
